tap.formatter

Class JSONFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • tap.formatter.JSONFormat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OutputFormat

    public class JSONFormat
extends java.lang.Object
implements OutputFormat
    Format any given query (table) result into JSON.
    Version:
    2.1 (08/2015)
    Author:
    Grégory Mantelet (CDS;ARI)

    • Field Summary

      The ServiceConnection to use (for the log and to have some information about the service (particularly: name, description).

      • writeResult

        public void writeResult(TableIterator result,
               java.io.OutputStream output,
               TAPExecutionReport execReport,
               java.lang.Thread thread)
                 throws TAPException,
                        java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: OutputFormat

        Formats the given query result and writes it in the given output stream.

        Note: the given output stream should not be closed at the end of this function. It is up to the called to do it.

        Specified by:
        writeResult in interface OutputFormat
        Parameters:
        result - The raw (table) result to format.
        output - The output stream (a ServletOutputStream or a stream on a file) in which the formatted result must be written.
        execReport - The report of the execution of the TAP query whose the result must be now written.
        thread - The thread which has asked the result writing.
        Throws:
        TAPException - If there is an error while formatting the query result.
        java.io.IOException - If any error occurs while writing into the given stream.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the query has been interrupted/aborted.

      • writeMetadata

        protected DBColumn[] writeMetadata(TableIterator result,
                       JSONWriter out,
                       TAPExecutionReport execReport,
                       java.lang.Thread thread)
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   TAPException,
                                   java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                   JSONException
        Write the whole metadata part of the JSON file.
        Parameters:
        result - Result to write later (but it contains also metadata that was extracted from the result itself).
        out - Output stream in which the metadata must be written.
        execReport - Execution report (which contains the metadata extracted/guessed from the ADQL query).
        thread - Thread which has asked for this formatting (it must be used in order to test the Thread.isInterrupted() flag and so interrupt everything if need).
        Returns:
        All the written metadata.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is an error while writing something in the output stream.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread has been interrupted.
        JSONException - If there is an error while formatting something in JSON.
        TAPException - If any other error occurs.
        See Also:
        getValidColMeta(DBColumn, TAPColumn)

      • getValidColMeta

        protected TAPColumn getValidColMeta(DBColumn typeFromQuery,
                        TAPColumn typeFromResult)
        Try to get or otherwise to build appropriate metadata using those extracted from the ADQL query and those extracted from the result.
        Parameters:
        typeFromQuery - Metadata extracted/guessed from the ADQL query.
        typeFromResult - Metadata extracted/guessed from the result.
        Returns:
        The most appropriate metadata.

      • writeFieldMeta

        protected void writeFieldMeta(TAPColumn tapCol,
                  JSONWriter out)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              TAPException,
                              JSONException
        Formats in JSON and writes the given TAPColumn in the given output.
        Parameters:
        tapCol - The column metadata to format/write in JSON.
        out - The stream in which the formatted column metadata must be written.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is an error while writing the field metadata.
        JSONException - If there is an error while formatting something in JSON format.
        TAPException - If there is any other error (by default: never happen).

      • writeData

        protected void writeData(TableIterator result,
             DBColumn[] selectedColumns,
             JSONWriter out,
             TAPExecutionReport execReport,
             java.lang.Thread thread)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         TAPException,
                         java.lang.InterruptedException,
                         JSONException
        Write the whole data part of the JSON file.
        Parameters:
        result - Result to write.
        selectedColumns - All columns' metadata.
        out - Output stream in which the data must be written.
        execReport - Execution report (which contains the maximum allowed number of records to output).
        thread - Thread which has asked for this formatting (it must be used in order to test the Thread.isInterrupted() flag and so interrupt everything if need).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is an error while writing something in the output stream.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread has been interrupted.
        JSONException - If there is an error while formatting something in JSON.
        TAPException - If any other error occurs.

      • writeFieldValue

        protected void writeFieldValue(java.lang.Object value,
                   DBColumn column,
                   JSONWriter out)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               TAPException,
                               JSONException

        Writes the given field value in JSON and into the given output.

        note: special numeric values NaN and Inf (double or float) will be written as NULL values.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to write.
        column - The corresponding column metadata.
        out - The stream in which the field value must be written.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is an error while writing the given field value in the given stream.
        TAPException - If there is any other error (by default: never happen).
        JSONException
